Pore/Structural Features.Structure Type: Layered 2D structure with interlayer pores and 1D channels along b-axis

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Pore-opening adsorption, size exclusion after framework expansion, kinetic selectivity.

Other Information.Additional Info: Adsorption induces a nonporous-to-porous transition and framework expansion from 1' (shrunk) to 1 (expanded).

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Size exclusion (single component); co-adsorption due to n-C4H10 induced pore opening; slower diffusion in expanded framework.

Other Information.Additional Info: Completely excluded as a single component. Trivial co-adsorption occurs in the presence of n-C4H10, which induces framework expansion, allowing some i-C4H10 passage.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Kinetic exclusion/negligible adsorption due to extremely small apertures and weak host-guest interactions.

Other Information.Additional Info: Exhibits very low uptake, particularly at 298 K, due to small apertures and weak interactions.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Pore-opening adsorption, structural transformation from 1' to 1.

Sieving Mechanism: Molecular sieving based on pore aperture, kinetic selectivity, and guest-induced structural transformation (pore-opening) in a flexible framework.

Experimental Validation.Method: Quantitative column breakthrough experiments, Single-component adsorption isotherms (N2, CO2, n-C4H10, i-C4H10), Adsorption kinetics measurements, In situ powder X-ray diffraction (PXRD), Single-crystal X-ray diffraction (SCXRD), Computational simulations (Configurational bias Monte Carlo, Density functional theory, Molecular dynamics).
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: n-C4H10/i-C4H10 adsorption selectivity: 23; Instant i-C4H10 purity: up to 99.97+%; Equilibrium uptake (mixture) n-C4H10: 0.75 mmol/g, i-C4H10: 0.033 mmol/g; Simulated diffusion coefficient n-C4H10: 64.5 x 10^-6 cm^2 s^-1, i-C4H10: 5.27 x 10^-6 cm^2 s^-1.

Other Information.Additional Info: This is a hydrogen-bonded porous molecular crystal (PMC), not a MOF, but it exhibits MOF-like behavior. Features exceptional hydrophobicity (water contact angle 134°) and high chemical stability (pH 2–13). The framework is flexible and undergoes trivial guest-induced structural transformation (pore opening).
